task.summary: Default task
Managed to set the orientation with the joint creation properly and parented the fingers to the arm. As it is now, the thumb still has to be rotated manually to curl in the palm
Cleaning up
Managed to build radio buttons interface, similar to the one in the joint creation tool and the orient joint tool.
Managed to build radio buttons interface, similar to the one in the joint creation tool and the orient joint tool.
Aligning the radio box
Created and connected radio buttons for joint creation to the main layout
Trying to connect the radio buttons interface with spawnJoints function
Working on integrating the radio buttons
Class restructuring
Class restructuring
Class restructuring
Class restructuring
Now parenting works for the hand and it doesn't mess witht the rest of the joints.

For some reason, Maya will flip the second joint in new hierarchy every time, but I have an idea how to fix it. Whenever that happens, the joint is fipped exactly 180 degrees, so perhaps I can query the hierarchy orientation and whenever there is 180 orientation, I can flip it back.
Managed to correct the filipping.
Managed to correct the flipping.

Restructured the class again by taking all static methods out of the class; created a couple of functions for parenting/unparenting the fingers for ease of use - unparenting is needed when applying new orientation, since when reorientated, the hand joint will point towards the first joint created after it, instead of following the elbow axis (I might b able to change that with 'position' in cmds.joint,which should orient the joint to world). More thorough commenting needs to be done.
Final touches for the day. Tested leg and hand with IKs, all seems fine. Will continue with proper commenting and will be looking into mirroring.

Fixed some orientation issues with secondary axis world orientation and l_hand_jnt orientation. Orientation is working properly now, but it works on all joints, instead of selection of joints. Next will work on that

Managed to set rotation order correctly for both leg and arm, or for world x and world y axis. Now when new orientation is applied, all joints are being adjusted accordingly. The code compares the position in world space of the first 2 joints to determine along which axis is the joint chain laid. Also now only selected joints are queried, instead of all of them, so joint chains now can be separately adjusted.

Managed to set rotation order correctly for both leg and arm, or for world x and world y axis. Now when new orientation is applied, all joints are being adjusted accordingly. The code compares the position in world space of the first 2 joints to determine along which axis is the joint chain laid. Also now only selected joints are queried, instead of all of them, so joint chains now can be separately adjusted. Updated main interface.

Managed to connect orientJoints function to createJointChain - now joints a created by spawnJoints and oriented with orientJoints in createJointChain. That way orientJoints is used to set orientation immediately after the joints are created, using the input from the radio buttons. Previously I could only use orientJoints for orienting the joints, and not for creating them. Still need to take care of the 'none' radio button, right now it does nothing.

Managed to connect orientJoints function to createJointChain - now joints a created by spawnJoints and oriented with orientJoints in createJointChain. That way orientJoints is used to set orientation immediately after the joints are created, using the input from the radio buttons. Previously I could only use orientJoints for orienting the joints, and not for creating them. Still need to take care of the 'none' radio button, right now it does nothing. Filled the comments

Working on controllers at test.py. At the moment controllers are spawned and aligned to the joints positions and orientations, where the controller's normal points in the same direction as the primary axis of the joint. Next step would be to group each controller and parent each according to the hierarchy.
Created matrix based FK controllers, but it seems they are not working with IK handles. I might need to go back to the traditional controllers with groups and parent constraints
Created another IK chain using direct parenting of the controls to the joint. Still not sure which method of creating controls is best for most cases.

It turned out that dictionaries in Python 2.x are not ordered and when I run the script in Maya 2020, which uses Python 2, the joint order is messed up, because the script is written in Python 3.7 (Maya 2022 uses Python 3), which has ordered dictionaries. So I created a version of the script that works in Python 2.x - instead of a dictionary, containing the names and the positions, I use 2 separate list, one for names and one for positions

It turned out that dictionaries in Python 2.x are not ordered and when I run the script in Maya 2020, which uses Python 2, the joint order is messed up, because the script is written in Python 3.7 (Maya 2022 uses Python 3), which has ordered dictionaries. So I created a version of the script that works in Python 2.x - instead of a dictionary, containing the names and the positions, I use 2 separate list, one for names and one for positions

Managed to create a function that spawns joint chain of predefined number of joints, space between them, axis along to spawn and radius for the controls. All controlls are grouped, matched transformations and zeroed and parent-constrained. Looking into IK FK switch. Setting out to rig a character with just joints for now and test the mirroring. Added some changes on the locators - now they spawn in yellow, so they are much easier to see; also their pivots are now centered to the object, instead of the center of the scene.
Adapted the function for control and group to the hand chain. The skeleton works absolutely fine when mirrored and connected
Finished FK function for spine
Finished FK function for spine
Completed IK/FK switch and controls for the hand. Next will be looking into fingers controls, drawing controls and code optimization

Added normal orientation check for the IK controller and created a function that will print out point positions of a given curve. The point positions can be used to spawn the same controller. Next will be looking into matching the transformation of the controllers when switching between IK and FK

Created function that calculates the correct position for the pole vector controller on the elbow and used the same function for creating seamless IK to FK and FK to IK switch; added it as a button and created reset button too. Also set colors for the different type controllers

Rearranged the controllers creating procedure - now the all finger controls are grouped first and then parented to l_hand_ctrl and groups is parent-constrained by the l_hand_jnt. This allows for the hand to be controlled by both the IK and the FK controls when switched respectively and the fingers do not stretch beyond the IK handle
Corrected finger controls
Edit duplicateJoints and createFKcontrols for the right hand at test.py. Will be working on integrating it with the rest of the code and potentially blend it with the left hand functions
Completed basic FK controls for the spine with additional waist control and successfully connected the pelvis to the legs.
Completed spine and successfully connected all components, moving onto eyes and jaw
Completed eye controls
Completed controls and component connection, moving onto locking attributes and testing
Completed controls and component connection, moving onto locking attributes, adjustments, interface and testing
Added root controls and edited component connections, looking into locking attributes
Updated locators positions
Improved orientation

Improved orientation, considering adding slider that sets the degree of tolerance for the secondary axis world orientation; it all works fine as it as set now for most of the cases, but it will still fail if the degrees between the joints in the chains are too extreme
Improved orientation and added couple of sliders, one for the fail tolerance for the orientation, and another one for setting the degree of rotation for the thumb, moving onto locking attributes
Updates on controls axis orientation

MESSAGE.value: Created matrix based FK controllers, but it seems they are not working with IK handles. I might need to go back to the traditional controllers with groups and parent constraints
Created another IK chain using direct parenting of the controls to the joint. Still not sure which method of creating controls is best for most cases.

It turned out that dictionaries in Python 2.x are not ordered and when I run the script in Maya 2020, which uses Python 2, the joint order is messed up, because the script is written in Python 3.7 (Maya 2022 uses Python 3), which has ordered dictionaries. So I created a version of the script that works in Python 2.x - instead of a dictionary, containing the names and the positions, I use 2 separate list, one for names and one for positions

Managed to create a function that spawns joint chain of predefined number of joints, space between them, axis along to spawn and radius for the controls. All controlls are grouped, matched transformations and zeroed and parent-constrained. Looking into IK FK switch. Setting out to rig a character with just joints for now and test the mirroring. Added some changes on the locators - now they spawn in yellow, so they are much easier to see; also their pivots are now centered to the object, instead of the center of the scene.
Adapted the function for control and group to the hand chain. The skeleton works absolutely fine when mirrored and connected
Finished FK function for spine
Completed IK/FK switch and controls for the hand. Next will be looking into fingers controls, drawing controls and code optimization

Added normal orientation check for the IK controller and created a function that will print out point positions of a given curve. The point positions can be used to spawn the same controller. Next will be looking into matching the transformation of the controllers when switching between IK and FK

Created function that calculates the correct position for the pole vector controller on the elbow and used the same function for creating seamless IK to FK and FK to IK switch; added it as a button and created reset button too. Also set colors for the different type controllers

Rearranged the controllers creating procedure - now the all finger controls are grouped first and then parented to l_hand_ctrl and groups is parent-constrained by the l_hand_jnt. This allows for the hand to be controlled by both the IK and the FK controls when switched respectively and the fingers do not stretch beyond the IK handle
Corrected finger controls
Edit duplicateJoints and createFKcontrols for the right hand at test.py. Will be working on integrating it with the rest of the code and potentially blend it with the left hand functions
Completed basic FK controls for the spine with additional waist control and successfully connected the pelvis to the legs.
Completed spine and successfully connected all components, moving onto eyes and jaw

Completed controls and component connection, moving onto locking attributes and testing
Completed controls and component connection, moving onto locking attributes, adjustments, interface and testing
Added root controls and edited component connections, looking into locking attributes
Updated locators positions
Improved orientation

Improved orientation, considering adding slider that sets the degree of tolerance for the secondary axis world orientation; it all works fine as it as set now for most of the cases, but it will still fail if the degrees between the joints in the chains are too extreme
Improved orientation and added couple of sliders, one for the fail tolerance for the orientation, and another one for setting the degree of rotation for the thumb, moving onto locking attributes

Check in
Check in
